result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Garrett Tronnes

8:13 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Adam Garrett Tronnes in court.  Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Adam Garrett Tronnes.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to all counts.  Atty Cohen states most discovery has been received but some electronic discovery is still needed. State is working on the electronic discovery.  Waives speedy trial. Atty Cohen asking to schedule next hearing after the new year.  Motions to be filled by 1/13/23. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 8:19 AM. bph

Filed by ADA Ballo. km

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.M.H and E.R.F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
